subject: Re: [junit] More info for "Could not invoke the suite() method" error

messageBody:
Peter--

I agree with you,in part. The suite method error has been plaguing me
as well. But I don't think printing directly to stdout or stderr is
what we want. Something more general would be better.

Perhaps BaseTestRunner should define:
void runFailed(String message, Throwable t)
{
runFailed(message);
}

Then subclasses can override the new runFailed if they want access to
the exception or error that caused the failure. Obviously, the calls to
runFailed() in BaseTestRunner would have to be changed, which is simple.

textui.TestRunner.runFailed() can then be changed to print the whole
stack trace, as you've suggested.

--Sameer

> I'm not sure if this is the right place to post this suggestion for a
> future feature of JUnit. I hope so.
>
> I think adding the following two lines to the "getTest" method of
> the "BaseTestRunner" class would save people a lot of debugging time.
>
> System.out.println(e.toString());
> e.printStackTrace();
>
> They would go right after the line with "Could not invoke the suite()
> method".
>
> I made the change to my copy of JUnit and it pointed me right to a
> classpath problem (after spending at least an hour guessing at what
> was wrong).
>
> However, as soon as the new version of JUnit is available, I'll lose
> the change. It's not hard to redo but I don't want to forget.
>
> Thanks,
> Peter
